docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Sean Combs said again yesterday that Jennifer Lopez, Mr. Combs's former girlfriend, might testify at his trial this week. Mr. Combs is expected to take the stand today at State Supreme Court in Manhattan in his trial on charges of illegal gun possession and bribing a witness.

headline.main: Now Combs's Lawyer Says Lopez May Take the Stand After All

docs.snippet: A woman who was shot and wounded during a scuffle in a Times Square nightclub in late 1999 testified yesterday that she saw the hip-hop impresario Sean Combs fire a pistol into the air just before a bullet hit her in the face.    The testimony by ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A woman who was shot and wounded during a scuffle in a Times Square nightclub in late 1999 testified yesterday that she saw the hip-hop impresario Sean Combs fire a pistol into the air just before a bullet hit her in the face. The testimony by the woman, Natania Reuben, marked the first time that a witness definitively declared that Mr. Combs, who is charged in State Supreme Court in Manhattan with gun possession and with bribing a witness, had a gun and that he fired it while at the nightclub.
docs.abstract: Natania Reuben, woman who was shot and wounded during scuffle in Times Square nightclub in late 1999, testifies that she saw hip-hop impresario Sean Combs fire pistol into air just before bullet hit her in face; testimony marks first time that witness definitely declared that Combs, who is charged with gun possession and bribing a witness, had gun and that he fired it at nightclub (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: LIVERPOOL, Oct. 22. -- The New York Giants and the Chicago White Sox baseball teams, which will play a series of exhibition games in England, beginning here tomorrow, arrived today on the Montroyal from Montreal. The ballplayers kept in condition aboard ship by systematic exercises.

headline.main: Giants and White Sox Arrive In England; Will Play Today

docs.lead_paragraph: The usual atmosphere of gayety and fun was displaced by one of sorrow yesterday afternoon at a gathering of members and guests of the Circus Saints and Sinners Club. In meetings of the past, the East Ballroom of the Hotel Commodore, where the group assembles monthly, has rung with laughter and jokes.

docs.snippet: LUNCH isn't something Baby Jane Dexter takes lightly.    Before we decided where to have ours, she had already checked out and vetoed an East Village spaghetti place she used to like. She considered the Union Square Cafe, which has the mashed pota...
docs.lead_paragraph: LUNCH isn't something Baby Jane Dexter takes lightly. Before we decided where to have ours, she had already checked out and vetoed an East Village spaghetti place she used to like. She considered the Union Square Cafe, which has the mashed potatoes with leeks that she adores, as well as a secluded table (No. 49) that makes her feel so comfortable that being there is almost as good as talking on the phone, her preferred method of holding a conversation.
docs.abstract: Interview with cabaret singer Baby Jane Dexter at Caffe Sha Sha in Greenwich Village; photo; Dexter, who sings blues, jazz and standards, discusses her vehemently personal act (S)

headline.main: A Heart That Knows The Blues
headline.kicker: AT LUNCH WITH: Baby Jane Dexter
